title.rendered: When does the root disappear with tooth decay?

content.rendered: The root bone of the tooth needs some components to maintain its shape and density. The sac-like alveos that surround and support the tooth supply these necessary components to the tooth. When a tooth decays, these alveos are also lost and the bone cannot be nourished. Therefore, the root bone is also lost. The more the tooth decays, the more it loses its function. This missing tooth causes serious aesthetic and functional problems in some people. After the alveolar deficiency destroys the tooth root, it begins to damage the basal bone layer under the bone. The main purpose of the implant is to prevent the process of damaging the jawbone. The implant fuses with your jawbone and prevents further tissue and bone loss.
